required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry of Patients With a Diagnosis of Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Long-Term Registry of Patients With a Diagnosis of Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA)

brief_summary.textblock:
Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) is a neurogenetic disorder caused by a loss or mutation in the survival motor neuron 1 gene (SMN1) on chromosome 5q13, which leads to reduced SMN protein levels and a selective dysfunction of motor neurons. SMA is an autosomal recessive, early childhood disease with an incidence of 1:10,000 live births. SMA is the leading cause of infant mortality due to genetic diseases.
Until recently, the mainstay of treatment for these patients was supportive medical care. However, advances in medical treatment focusing on gene replacement, gene enhancement, motor neuron protection and muscle enhancement is likely to change the management and prognosis of these patients in the future.
The purpose of this registry is to assess the long term outcomes of patients with SMA in the context of advances in treatment options.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, multi center, multinational, non-interventional observational study. All patients will be managed according to the clinical site's normal clinical practice, i.e., the diagnostic and clinical treatment/practice process that a clinician chooses according to their clinical judgement for an SMA patient. Clinical care will not be driven by the protocol. No additional visits or investigations will be performed beyond normal clinical practice. Patients will be followed for 15 years from enrolment or until death, whichever is sooner.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in probability of survival of all patients with SMA using Kaplan Meier method to estimate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Based on information collected at Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow-up, then annually through 15 years of follow up.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Children's Hospital of Philadelphia Infant Test of Neuromuscular Disorders (CHOP-INTEND) in infants with pre-symptomatic or type I SMA
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
primary_outcome.description: CHOP INTEND score ranges from 0 to 64 with higher scores indicating higher motor function

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Hammersmith Infant Neurological Examination (HINE) in infants with pre-symptomatic, type I or type II SMA
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
primary_outcome.description: HINE score range from 0 to 26 with higher scores indicating more development.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Hammersmith Functional Motor Scale Expanded (HFMSE) for patients with type II and III SMA
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
primary_outcome.description: HFMSE score range from 0 to 66 with the higher scores indicating more development.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events
Incidence of treatment emergent serious adverse events
Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events related to therapy
Incidence of treatment emergent thrombocytopenia, hepatotoxicity and cardiac adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in rates of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Zarit Burden Interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Zarit Burden Total Score ranges from 0 to 88. A higher score correlates with higher level of burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in PedsQL Patient interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
secondary_outcome.description: PedsQL Total Scale Score is average of all items and ranges from 0 to 100. A higher score correlates with better Health-Related Quality of Life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in PedsQL Parent interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up
secondary_outcome.description: PedsQL Total Scale Score is average of all items and ranges from 0 to 100. A higher score correlates with better Health-Related Quality of Life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in percent of patients requiring ventilator support (BiPAP, Endotracheal tube)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: : Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in in percent of patients requiring nutritional support (Gastrostomy Tube, Gastrojejunal tube (GT) with Nissen fundoplication, GT without Nissen fundoplication, Nasogastrictube, Nasojejunaltube or Percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in in percent of patients requiring mobility device support (Ankle-Foot Orthoses, Supramalleolar Orthosis, Orthotic/shoe inserts, Knee immobilizers, Knee-Ankle-Foot Orthoses , Hand splints, Spinal bracing)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: : Baseline and every 6 months through 2 years of follow up, then annually through 15 years of follow up

arm_group.description: This is a prospective, multi center, multinational, non-interventional observational registry.

intervention.description: This prospective observational registry will assess long-term outcomes of patients with a diagnosis of SMA.

study_pop.textblock: The study will enrol at least 500 patients with a diagnosis of SMA. The registry will attempt to enrol all patients treated with AVXS-101 in the registry during 5 years of recruitment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with SMA, genetically confirmed on or after 24 May 2018.
- Appropriate consent/assent has been obtained for participation in the registry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently enrolled in an interventional clinical trial involving an investigational medicinal product to treat SMA.
Note: Patients that are participating in a Compassionate Use Program (CUP) for AVXS-101 (Zolgensma) such as a Managed Access Program (MAP), an Expanded Access Program (EAP), Single Patient Investigational New Drug (IND) (SPI) or Named Patient Program (NPP) are eligible to enroll in the registry regardless of the date of genetic confirmation of SMA.

facility.name: University of California Los Angeles Health
University of California Davis Health System
Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis
The State University of New York

reference.citation: Sugarman EA, Nagan N, Zhu H, Akmaev VR, Zhou Z, Rohlfs EM, Flynn K, Hendrickson BC, Scholl T, Sirko-Osadsa DA, Allitto BA. Pan-ethnic carrier screening and prenatal diagnosis for spinal muscular atrophy: clinical laboratory analysis of >72,400 specimens. Eur J Hum Genet. 2012 Jan;20(1):27-32. doi: 10.1038/ejhg.2011.134. Epub 2011 Aug 3.

patient_data.ipd_description: Authorship of planned manuscripts for submission to medical journals shall be determined in accordance with the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors (ICMJE) Uniform Requirements for Manuscripts Submitted to Biomedical Journals (www.icmje.org). The physician agrees that if the physician is part of a multi-center registry, the physician shall coordinate in advance any intended disclosure of the results of the registry with AveXis to ensure that the results of individual physicians are not published or presented before those of the multi-center registry, unless otherwise agreed to in writing by AveXis.
